meanings.definition: To coat or cover a surface with plaster or cement.
meanings.sent1: The workers parged the wall to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: She parged the foundation to protect it from the weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to parged its fur with mud, thinking it was plaster.
meanings.sent4: His words parged her heart with a sense of warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The artist parged the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A layer of plaster or cement applied to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a thick parged wall that kept it warm.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a crack in the parged surface of the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the parged floor was made of candy.
meanings.sent4: The parged layer on the statue gave it a lifelike appearance.
meanings.sent5: The parged area on the sidewalk was slippery after the rain.
